And then here's for me the critical key
to what Julian has to say. The copyright
policy isn't just about how to
incentivize the production of a certain
kind of artistic commodity. It's about
what level of control we're going to

realities. Social realities that are now
inevitably permeated by pop culture. I
think it's important that we keep these
two different kinds of public goods in
mind. If we're only focused on how to
maximize the supply of one, I think we
risk suppressing this different and and
richer and in some ways maybe even more
important one.

Now that picture of an ecology of

as you all know, not many of us believe

the mysterious WMG
that matched their content ID. So, I

My whole 45minute video had been

interestingly, they still sold ads for

video, you could still buy the music,

extraordinarily Bart Simpson like
juvenile way, you've actually got to

And we're not going to see this change

It's a value respecting the creator.
